Coatings maker PPG Industries to buy Mexico's Comex for $2.3 blnUPDATE 3-U.S. chemicals maker PPG to buy Mexico's Comex for $2.3 blnU.S. chemicals maker PPG to buy Mexico's Comex for $2.3 billion MEXICO CITY U.S. chemicals maker PPG Industries Inc  said on Monday it had agreed to buy paints maker Consorcio Comex SA de CV for $2.3 billion after the Mexican company's deal to sell to U.S. rival Sherwin-Williams Co  fell through.  U.S. chemicals maker PPG to buy Mexico's Comex for $2.3 billion MEXICO CITY U.S. chemicals maker PPG Industries Inc  said on Monday it had agreed to buy paints maker Consorcio Comex SA de CV for $2.3 billion after the Mexican company's deal to sell to U.S. rival Sherwin-Williams Co  fell through. * Deal will help PPG expand paints offering in Mexico

Activist Peltz builds up $1 billion stake in BNY Mellon June 30 Activist investor Nelson Peltz has built up a $1 billion stake in BNY Mellon Corp in what could lead to a shakeup over lagging stock performance and rising operating expenses at the world's largest custody bank.
